meanings.definition: A retractable keel or board on a sailboat used to prevent leeway.
meanings.sent1: The centerboards on the sailboat help keep it steady in the water.
meanings.sent2: The sailors lowered the centerboards to improve the boat's stability.
meanings.sent3: When the mischievous seagull landed on the centerboards, the boat started spinning in circles.
meanings.sent4: The centerboards acted like anchors, holding the boat in place amidst the strong currents.
meanings.sent5: The shiny centerboards gleamed in the sunlight, guiding the boat's course.

meanings.definition: A board or plank in the center of a floor or ceiling.
meanings.sent1: The workers installed the centerboards in the middle of the room for support.
meanings.sent2: The centerboards in the attic creaked under the weight of old boxes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat loved to walk along the centerboards, pretending it was a tightrope.
meanings.sent4: The centerboards in the gymnasium held the weight of the entire basketball court above.
meanings.sent5: The centerboards in the basement were painted a bright red to match the walls.
